comments:
- Clear your workspace entirely.
- Start workbench.
- Close resources perspective, and open profiling & logging perspective.
- Go to the log navigator view.
- Right click on the Symptom Databases folder, select New > Symptom Database.
- Enter "Test" for all 3 fields. Click finish.
- Click Yes for the pop-up dialog.
- Note: Stack trace printed to console. Symptom Database editor doesn't open.

This is not a major bug. The only problem for the user are the exception itself 
and the fact that the editor doesn't open. It will open properly if you double 
click on the symptom database. Also, this only happens on the first time the 
editor is being opened. After that, it opens properly with no exception. Here 
is the stack trace:

The problem was actually caused by the fact that MultiPageEditorPart.activePage
() was returning null, this problem was fixed in the new workbench base IES I-
I20040514-200405141501.
